Exaggerate: The claim states that Scott Walker's "listening sessions" are "invite-only and excluding the press." This may be an exaggeration if there are certain circumstances in which the press is allowed or if the claim implies that all of Walker's listening sessions are completely closed to the press.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to determine whether the listening sessions are truly invite-only and exclude the press.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that invite-only listening sessions excluding the press are inherently not good, without providing further explanation or justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
